title: Highly-anticipated Houston Super Bowl party canceled

Photo: The Player's Party (Official Site) Image 1 of / 51 51 If you were looking forward to The Players Party at the Sam Houston Race Park you will need to change your weekend plans. The Players Party slated to kick off today and run through Sunday, Feb. 5 at the race park has been canceled, according to the party's social media accounts.
Click through for other Super Bowl parties you can hit up....

Event: Atlanta Falcons Devonta Freeman and New England Patriots Malcolm Butler to Wear Customized Cleats During Super Bowl Pre-Game Warmups:
Visit the Microsoft’s NFLX location for your opportunity to design the cleats using Sketchable, a feature rich drawing app, on Microsoft’s new Surface Studio and Surface Hub devices.
World-renowned cleat artist Marcus Rivero will create Bulter and Davonta's favorite cleate design live at the Microsoft space at NFLX on Thursday, February 2 from 3-4 p.m. and 5-8 p.m.

Event: Big Game at Macy's Galleria: During the week leading up to the championship game, Macy’s at the Galleria Mall will host a sensational line-up of in-store special events, player appearances, cooking demos, and a championship-worthy 4,000-square-foot Locker Room by LIDS pop-up shop.
Wednesday, Feb. 1 through Sunday, Feb. 5- The Locker Room by LIDS pop-up shop and Custom Zone, located on the main floor of the Men’s department, will feature the largest selection of football fan gear. Shoppers can customize game day caps and jerseys with their favorite player’s embroidered name, number or signature onsite. The shop will be open beginning
Appearances:
-Saturday, Jan. 28 at 3 p.m. (Home Dept., level 3) meet Chef Bryan Caswell. More information here .
- Thursday, February 2, at 6 p.m. (Macy’s End Zone, level 1) meet Pro Football Hall of Famer, Jim Brown, courtesy of Majestic.
- Friday, February 3 at 5 p.m. (Macy’s End Zone, level 1) meet actress, fashion designer and philanthropist Alyssa Milano.
- Saturday, February 4 at 3 p.m. (Macy’s End Zone, level 1) meet Pro Football Hall of Famer and pro football’s all-time rushing leader, Emmitt Smith, courtesy of Majestic.
At 2 p.m. on level three of the Kids’ Department, tailgaters big and small are welcome to celebrate all things football with a fun-filled afternoon of art, music and more for the whole family.

Photo: Marcus Ingram/WireImage Image 51 of 51 Highly-anticipated Houston Super Bowl party canceled 1 / 51 Back to Gallery If you were looking forward to The Players Party at the Sam Houston Race Park you will need to change your weekend plans.
The Players Party slated to kick off today and run through Sunday, Feb. 5 at the race park has been canceled, according to the party's social media accounts.
MARK IT: Super Bowl party roster: Pull out your social calendars
"Due to unforeseen circumstances, this event has been canceled. We appreciate your interest and apologize for any inconvenience. Ticket holders will receive a full refund credited to their account within 48-72 hours," read a notice on the party's Facebook page.
Front Gate Tickets, the agent selling the tickets , confirmed the cancellation via a recording on its toll-free hotline.
The party was to feature musical performances from the likes of The Beach Boys, Hunter Hayes, Montgomery Gentry, KC and the Sunshine Band, Tracy Byrd and others.
SELFIE TIME: Houston becomes celebrity spotting center during Super Bowl week
The list of sporting legends set to appear included Drew Brees, Earl Campbell, Warren Moon, Dan Pastorini, Calvin Murphy, Adrian Peterson, Larry Dierker, Tim Tebow, and various other luminaries. Autograph sessions were also planned with some of the stars.
Tickets for the event ranged from $24 to $79, with special packages available. Ticket buyers were also to receive a digital gift bag valued at $500.
BUMMER: Super Bowl LI parties you can't get into - unless you're a VIP
At least one disappointed fan on social media said they were traveling from the West Coast for the party.
If you had your heart set on going to the bash, fear not, as there are more than a parties to satisfy the party animal in you over the weekend. There are still free events and concerts at the Super Bowl Live complex and nearly every bar in Houston will be throwing some sort of shindig or another.
Some are cheaper than others.
We've reached to the organizers to see if they can explain the reason behind the cancellation.
